intro: Psoralea archeri, commonly known as the mountain psoralea, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are often pinnately compound, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Psoralea archeri is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and ecological significance in its native habitat.
